revised_title: Magnetic Properties of Exchange Coupled Iridium Ions
tldr: The authors investigated the magnetic properties of three exchange coupled iridium ions in face-centered cubic lattice structures. They measured the isotropic and anisotropic exchange interactions between the ions, providing insights into the antiferromagnetic properties of the concentrated salts. The results were used in the spin wave theory to predict the magnetic ordering and showed a satisfactory agreement with experimental findings.
